channel.title: Surround decoder patch
channel.description:
i just wanted to share my surround decoder patch, it uses the left out channel for mono surround, and the right out channel for the center channel
it sound pretty nice to me, oh and compare the outputs with a headphone for example :D
several params are adjustable too (for those wanting a patched stereo width control, there's a few of those in the project ;) )
link:
http://inaba.nl/?Downloads___Surround_processor
i think i am going to use it in a diy receiver, not fully sure though.
edit 1: [28 june 2016]
changed some stuff: 1 axoloti for a pair of rear surround channels 1 axoloti for a pair of side surround channels (lastly) 1 axoloti for a center and subwoofer no modifications on the left/right channels

item.title: Surround decoder patch
item.dc:creator: @Inaba ramon
item.description:
@Inaba wrote:

For these patches i settled on making a surround sound decoder/enhancer with 4 axoloti + 1 control mcu.

Will be making a new thread in "Your projects' for this soon.

Also, link had been dead for over a year now, though i will upload it sometime again

Read full topic

i just wanted to share my surround decoder patch, it uses the left out channel for mono surround, and the right out channel for the center channel

it sound pretty nice to me, oh and compare the outputs with a headphone for example

several params are adjustable too (for those wanting a patched stereo width control, there's a few of those in the project )
